title: Architecting AgentOS: From Token-Level Context to Emergent System-Level Intelligence
summary: The paradigm of Large Language Models is undergoing a fundamental transition from static inference engines to dynamic autonomous cognitive systems.While current research primarily focuses on scaling context windows or optimizing prompt engineering the theoretical bridge between micro scale token processing and macro scale systemic intelligence remains fragmented.This paper proposes AgentOS,a holistic conceptual framework that redefines the LLM as a "Reasoning Kernel" governed by structured operating system logic.Central to this architecture is Deep Context Management which conceptualizes the context window as an Addressable Semantic Space rather than a passive buffer.We systematically deconstruct the transition from discrete sequences to coherent cognitive states introducing mechanisms for Semantic Slicing and Temporal Alignment to mitigate cognitive drift in multi-agent orchestration.By mapping classical OS abstractions such as memory paging interrupt handling and process scheduling onto LLM native constructs, this review provides a rigorous roadmap for architecting resilient scalable and self-evolving cognitive environments.Our analysis asserts that the next frontier of AGI development lies in the architectural efficiency of system-level coordination.

AI.tldr: 本文提出AgentOS概念框架，将大语言模型重新定义为受操作系统逻辑管理的"推理内核"，通过深度上下文管理、语义分片和时序对齐机制，解决微观token处理与宏观系统智能之间的理论鸿沟。
AI.motivation: 当前研究过于聚焦上下文窗口扩展和提示工程优化，缺乏连接微观token级处理与宏观系统级智能的理论桥梁，导致从静态推理引擎向动态自主认知系统的范式转换存在严重碎片化问题。
AI.method: 提出AgentOS框架，将操作系统核心抽象（内存分页、中断处理、进程调度）映射到LLM原生结构，引入可寻址语义空间替代被动缓冲区，通过语义分片和时序对齐机制实现从离散序列到连贯认知状态的转换并缓解多智能体编排中的认知漂移。
AI.result: 系统性地解构了认知状态转换过程，为构建弹性、可扩展、自演化的认知环境提供了严谨的架构路线图。
AI.conclusion: 断言AGI发展的下一个前沿在于系统级协调的架构效率，大语言模型的未来突破将取决于操作系统设计原则在认知架构中的应用深度。

title: LogicGraph : Benchmarking Multi-Path Logical Reasoning via Neuro-Symbolic Generation and Verification
summary: Evaluations of large language models (LLMs) primarily emphasize convergent logical reasoning, where success is defined by producing a single correct proof. However, many real-world reasoning problems admit multiple valid derivations, requiring models to explore diverse logical paths rather than committing to one route. To address this limitation, we introduce LogicGraph, the first benchmark aimed to systematically evaluate multi-path logical reasoning, constructed via a neuro-symbolic framework that leverages backward logic generation and semantic instantiation. This pipeline yields solver-verified reasoning problems formalized by high-depth multi-path reasoning and inherent logical distractions, where each instance is associated with an exhaustive set of minimal proofs. We further propose a reference-free evaluation framework to rigorously assess model performance in both convergent and divergent regimes. Experiments on state-of-the-art language models reveal a common limitation: models tend to commit early to a single route and fail to explore alternatives, and the coverage gap grows substantially with reasoning depth. LogicGraph exposes this divergence gap and provides actionable insights to motivate future improvements. Our code and data will be released at https://github.com/kkkkarry/LogicGraph.

AI.tldr: 该论文针对大语言模型评估仅关注收敛性逻辑推理（单一正确证明）的局限，提出首个多路径逻辑推理基准LogicGraph。通过神经符号框架生成高深度多路径推理问题，发现现有模型倾向于过早承诺单一推理路径，且该缺陷随推理深度显著加剧，为模型改进提供了新方向。
AI.motivation: 当前大语言模型评估主要强调收敛性逻辑推理，即产生单一正确证明即可成功。然而许多现实世界推理问题允许多种有效推导路径，需要模型探索多样化逻辑路线而非固守单一方案。现有评估体系无法充分衡量模型在发散性推理场景下的真实能力，这限制了对模型推理能力的全面理解。
AI.method: 1. 构建LogicGraph基准：首次系统评估多路径逻辑推理能力；2. 采用神经符号框架，结合反向逻辑生成与语义实例化技术；3. 生成求解器验证的高深度多路径推理问题，包含内在逻辑干扰项；4. 为每个实例关联详尽的最小证明集合；5. 设计无参考评估框架，严格评估模型在收敛性和发散性两种范式下的表现。
AI.result: 在先进语言模型上的实验揭示共同局限：模型倾向于过早承诺单一推理路径，无法充分探索替代方案。这种覆盖差距随推理深度增加而显著扩大。LogicGraph暴露了这种发散性差距，为未来改进提供了可操作的见解。
AI.conclusion: LogicGraph基准测试填补了多路径逻辑推理评估的空白，揭示了当前大语言模型在发散性推理方面的严重缺陷。研究强调了探索多样化推理路径的重要性，并为开发更稳健的推理模型指明了方向。代码和数据将开源以促进后续研究。

title: A Long-Short Flow-Map Perspective for Drifting Models
summary: This paper provides a reinterpretation of the Drifting Model~\cite{deng2026generative} through a semigroup-consistent long-short flow-map factorization. We show that a global transport process can be decomposed into a long-horizon flow map followed by a short-time terminal flow map admitting a closed-form optimal velocity representation, and that taking the terminal interval length to zero recovers exactly the drifting field together with a conservative impulse term required for flow-map consistency. Based on this perspective, we propose a new likelihood learning formulation that aligns the long-short flow-map decomposition with density evolution under transport. We validate the framework through both theoretical analysis and empirical evaluations on benchmark tests, and further provide a theoretical interpretation of the feature-space optimization while highlighting several open problems for future study.

AI.tldr: 本文通过半群一致的长短流映射分解重新诠释漂移模型，提出一种新的似然学习框架。该方法将全局传输过程分解为长时程流映射与具有闭式最优速度的短时终端流映射，并证明当终端时间趋于零时可精确恢复漂移场及保持流映射一致性的保守脉冲项。通过理论分析与基准测试验证了框架有效性，并提供了特征空间优化的理论解释。
AI.motivation: 现有漂移模型缺乏从流映射分解角度的理论解释，难以建立与密度演化过程的直接关联。为此，作者旨在通过半群一致的数学框架，为漂移模型提供更严谨的理论基础，增强生成过程的可解释性。
AI.method: 采用半群一致的长短流映射分解方法：1) 将全局传输过程分解为长时程流映射与短时终端流映射；2) 推导终端流映射的闭式最优速度表达式；3) 通过极限分析证明终端区间趋于零时分解可精确恢复漂移场及维持流映射一致性的保守脉冲项；4) 基于该分解提出与密度演化对齐的似然学习新公式。
AI.result: 理论证明了长短流映射分解的数学性质及其与漂移模型的等价性；在基准测试上的实证评估验证了框架有效性；同时给出了特征空间优化的理论解释。
AI.conclusion: 该研究成功构建了漂移模型的新理论解释框架，通过流映射分解与密度演化的对齐为生成建模提供了更坚实的数学基础，并指出了若干未来研究的开放性问题。

title: Tool Building as a Path to "Superintelligence"
summary: The Diligent Learner framework suggests LLMs can achieve superintelligence via test-time search, provided a sufficient step-success probability $γ$. In this work, we design a benchmark to measure $γ$ on logical out-of-distribution inference. We construct a class of tasks involving GF(2) circuit reconstruction that grow more difficult with each reasoning step, and that are, from an information-theoretic standpoint, impossible to reliably solve unless the LLM carefully integrates all of the information provided. Our analysis demonstrates that while the $γ$ value for small LLMs declines superlinearly as depth increases, frontier models exhibit partial robustness on this task. Furthermore, we find that successful reasoning at scale is contingent upon precise tool calls, identifying tool design as a critical capability for LLMs to achieve general superintelligence through the Diligent Learner framework.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过构建GF(2)电路重建的逻辑分布外推理基准，量化测量大语言模型在"勤奋学习者"框架下的步骤成功概率γ。实验表明小模型γ值随推理深度超线性衰减，前沿模型展现部分鲁棒性，且精确工具调用是实现规模化推理的关键。
AI.motivation: 检验"勤奋学习者"框架的核心前提——大语言模型能否通过测试时搜索实现超级智能，关键在于其在复杂逻辑推理任务上是否维持足够的步骤成功概率γ。
AI.method: 设计一类随推理步骤递增难度的GF(2)电路重建任务，这些任务从信息论角度除非模型完整整合所有信息否则无法可靠求解，以此作为测量γ的基准测试。
AI.result: 小参数量模型的γ值随推理深度呈超线性下降趋势；前沿大模型在该任务上表现出部分鲁棒性；成功的规模化推理高度依赖于精确的工具调用机制。
AI.conclusion: 工具设计能力是大语言模型通过"勤奋学习者"框架迈向通用超级智能的关键瓶颈。

title: The Initial Exploration Problem in Knowledge Graph Exploration
summary: Knowledge Graphs (KGs) enable the integration and representation of complex information across domains, but their semantic richness and structural complexity create substantial barriers for lay users without expertise in semantic web technologies. When encountering an unfamiliar KG, such users face a distinct orientation challenge: they do not know what questions are possible, how the knowledge is structured, or how to begin exploration. This paper identifies and theorises this phenomenon as the Initial Exploration Problem (IEP). Drawing on theories from information behaviour and human-computer interaction, including ASK, exploratory search, information foraging, and cognitive load theory, we develop a conceptual framing of the IEP characterised by three interdependent barriers: scope uncertainty, ontology opacity, and query incapacity. We argue that these barriers converge at the moment of first contact, distinguishing the IEP from related concepts that presuppose an existing starting point or information goal. Analysing KG exploration interfaces at the level of interaction primitives, we suggest that many systems rely on epistemic assumptions that do not hold at first contact. This reveals a structural gap in the design space: the absence of interaction primitives for scope revelation, mechanisms that communicate what a KG contains without requiring users to formulate queries or interpret ontological structures. In articulating the IEP, this paper provides a theoretical lens for evaluating KG interfaces and for designing entry-point scaffolding that supports initial exploration.

AI.tldr: 本文理论化知识图谱的"初始探索问题"(IEP)，识别范围不确定性、本体不透明性和查询无能三大障碍，揭示现有系统在首次接触时缺乏作用域揭示交互原语的结构性设计空白。
AI.motivation: 知识图谱的跨领域信息整合能力虽强，但其语义丰富性和结构复杂性对非专业用户构成显著障碍。用户在首次接触未知KG时面临方向迷失：不知可能提问、知识结构为何或如何入手。
AI.method: 基于信息行为与人机交互理论（ASK模型、探索性搜索、信息觅食理论、认知负荷理论），构建IEP概念框架，并从交互原语层面批判性分析KG探索界面。
AI.result: 理论化IEP为首次接触时的三大互依障碍——范围不确定性、本体不透明性和查询无能；揭示现有系统依赖"已存在起点或信息目标"的认知假设，导致作用域揭示机制缺失。
AI.conclusion: 提供评估KG界面的理论透镜，指导设计入口点脚手架，支持用户初始探索，填补首次接触时的交互设计空白。

title: Actor-Curator: Co-adaptive Curriculum Learning via Policy-Improvement Bandits for RL Post-Training
comment: 37 pages, 8 figures, 1 table. Preprint under review. Equal contribution by first two authors
summary: Post-training large foundation models with reinforcement learning typically relies on massive and heterogeneous datasets, making effective curriculum learning both critical and challenging. In this work, we propose ACTOR-CURATOR, a scalable and fully automated curriculum learning framework for reinforcement learning post-training of large language models (LLMs). ACTOR-CURATOR learns a neural curator that dynamically selects training problems from large problem banks by directly optimizing for expected policy performance improvement. We formulate problem selection as a non-stationary stochastic bandit problem, derive a principled loss function based on online stochastic mirror descent, and establish regret guarantees under partial feedback. Empirically, ACTOR-CURATOR consistently outperforms uniform sampling and strong curriculum baselines across a wide range of challenging reasoning benchmarks, demonstrating improved training stability and efficiency. Notably, it achieves relative gains of 28.6% on AIME2024 and 30.5% on ARC-1D over the strongest baseline and up to 80% speedup. These results suggest that ACTOR-CURATOR is a powerful and practical approach for scalable LLM post-training.

AI.tldr: 本文提出ACTOR-CURATOR，一种用于大语言模型强化学习后训练的全自动课程学习框架。该方法将问题选择建模为非平稳随机老虎机问题，基于在线镜像下降推导损失函数并提供遗憾界保证。实验显示，在AIME2024和ARC-1D等推理基准上分别实现28.6%和30.5%的相对性能提升，训练速度最高提升80%，显著优于均匀采样和强基线方法。
AI.motivation: 大语言模型后训练依赖海量异构数据，有效课程学习至关重要但极具挑战性。传统手动课程设计效率低下且难以扩展，现有自动化方法在处理大规模问题库和非平稳性方面存在局限。因此，亟需可扩展的全自动框架来动态优化样本选择，以最大化策略性能改进效率。
AI.method: ACTOR-CURATOR框架学习一个神经策展人动态选择训练问题。核心方法包括：1) 将问题选择形式化为非平稳随机老虎机问题；2) 基于在线随机镜像下降推导出原则性损失函数；3) 在部分反馈机制下建立遗憾界保证。该框架完全自动化，直接优化预期策略性能提升。
AI.result: 在多个挑战性推理基准测试中，ACTOR-CURATOR持续优于均匀采样和强课程学习基线。具体结果：AIME2024相对提升28.6%，ARC-1D相对提升30.5%，训练效率最高提升80%。同时显著改善训练稳定性和样本效率。
AI.conclusion: ACTOR-CURATOR为大语言模型可扩展后训练提供了强大实用的解决方案。其理论保证与实证效果表明，该框架能有效应对大规模异构数据环境下的课程学习挑战，为未来大模型训练提供了重要的方法论支撑。

title: GATES: Self-Distillation under Privileged Context with Consensus Gating
comment: 10 Pages of main text with an additional 7 pages of supplementary material
summary: We study self-distillation in settings where supervision is unreliable: there are no ground truth labels, verifiable rewards, or external graders to evaluate answers. We focus on document-grounded question answering with asymmetric context, where a single model serves as both tutor (with access to a relevant source document during training) and student (answering from the question alone at test time). Rather than assuming tutor correctness, we derive supervision online from tutor consensus by sampling multiple document-grounded reasoning traces and using agreement to gate learning. Conditioned on this reliability signal, we distill knowledge through full tutor reasoning trajectories (not just final answers), providing a dense and stable learning signal. Empirically, this consensus-gated trajectory distillation substantially improves transfer to the document-free student. Held-out in-domain accuracy under asymmetric evaluation improves from 46.0\% to 62.0\%, and average (maj@8) accuracy on public document-free math benchmarks improves from 20.2\% to 35.4\%.

AI.tldr: 针对无可靠监督信号（无标签、奖励或外部评估）场景，研究文档 grounded 问答中非对称上下文的自蒸馏问题。提出通过抽样多个文档 grounded 推理轨迹并基于导师共识生成在线监督，利用完整轨迹进行蒸馏，显著提升了学生模型性能。
AI.motivation: 传统监督学习依赖可靠监督信号，但许多场景缺乏真实标签、可验证奖励或外部评估者。在文档 grounded 问答中，训练时导师可访问文档而测试时学生只能基于问题作答，这种非对称性使知识蒸馏面临挑战，尤其当导师答案不可靠时。
AI.method: 提出共识门控的轨迹蒸馏方法：1）单模型同时作为导师和学生；2）采样多个文档 grounded 推理轨迹，以导师自身的多轨迹一致性作为可靠性信号；3）基于共识筛选高质量轨迹；4）蒸馏时使用完整推理轨迹（而非仅最终答案）提供密集稳定的学习信号。
AI.result: 实验效果显著：域内非对称评估准确率从46.0%提升至62.0%；公开文档无关数学基准测试的maj@8平均准确率从20.2%提升至35.4%。
AI.conclusion: 在无可靠监督信号时，利用模型自身多轨迹共识作为在线监督并结合完整推理轨迹蒸馏，可有效解决非对称知识迁移问题，为弱监督学习提供了新范式。

title: Wireless Federated Multi-Task LLM Fine-Tuning via Sparse-and-Orthogonal LoRA
summary: Decentralized federated learning (DFL) based on low-rank adaptation (LoRA) enables mobile devices with multi-task datasets to collaboratively fine-tune a large language model (LLM) by exchanging locally updated parameters with a subset of neighboring devices via wireless connections for knowledge integration.However, directly aggregating parameters fine-tuned on heterogeneous datasets induces three primary issues across the DFL life-cycle: (i) \textit{catastrophic knowledge forgetting during fine-tuning process}, arising from conflicting update directions caused by data heterogeneity; (ii) \textit{inefficient communication and convergence during model aggregation process}, due to bandwidth-intensive redundant model transmissions; and (iii) \textit{multi-task knowledge interference during inference process}, resulting from incompatible knowledge representations coexistence during inference. To address these issues in a fully decentralized scenario, we first propose a sparse-and-orthogonal LoRA that ensures orthogonality between model updates to eliminate direction conflicts during fine-tuning.Then, we analyze how device connection topology affects multi-task performance, prompting a cluster-based topology design during aggregation.Finally, we propose an implicit mixture of experts (MoE) mechanism to avoid the coexistence of incompatible knowledge during inference. Simulation results demonstrate that the proposed approach effectively reduces communication resource consumption by up to $73\%$ and enhances average performance by $5\%$ compared with the traditional LoRA method.

AI.tldr: 针对基于LoRA的分布式联邦学习在异构多任务数据微调LLM时面临的灾难性遗忘、通信低效和知识干扰问题，本文提出稀疏正交LoRA、基于聚类的拓扑结构和隐式MoE机制的三阶段解决方案，实现73%通信开销降低和5%性能提升。
AI.motivation: 在去中心化场景下，移动设备需协作微调大语言模型，但异构多任务数据导致微调过程中的灾难性知识遗忘、聚合过程中的低效通信与收敛、以及推理过程中的多任务知识干扰三大核心问题。
AI.method: 提出稀疏正交LoRA确保模型更新正交性以消除方向冲突；通过分析设备连接拓扑对多任务性能的影响设计基于聚类的聚合拓扑；引入隐式混合专家机制避免推理时的不兼容知识共存。
AI.result: 仿真结果表明，所提方法相比传统LoRA可降低73%通信资源消耗，并将平均性能提升5%。
AI.conclusion: 该完全去中心化方案有效解决了DFL全生命周期中的三大挑战，为异构设备协作微调大模型提供了高效可行的技术路径。

title: CG-DMER: Hybrid Contrastive-Generative Framework for Disentangled Multimodal ECG Representation Learning
summary: Accurate interpretation of electrocardiogram (ECG) signals is crucial for diagnosing cardiovascular diseases. Recent multimodal approaches that integrate ECGs with accompanying clinical reports show strong potential, but they still face two main concerns from a modality perspective: (1) intra-modality: existing models process ECGs in a lead-agnostic manner, overlooking spatial-temporal dependencies across leads, which restricts their effectiveness in modeling fine-grained diagnostic patterns; (2) inter-modality: existing methods directly align ECG signals with clinical reports, introducing modality-specific biases due to the free-text nature of the reports. In light of these two issues, we propose CG-DMER, a contrastive-generative framework for disentangled multimodal ECG representation learning, powered by two key designs: (1) Spatial-temporal masked modeling is designed to better capture fine-grained temporal dynamics and inter-lead spatial dependencies by applying masking across both spatial and temporal dimensions and reconstructing the missing information. (2) A representation disentanglement and alignment strategy is designed to mitigate unnecessary noise and modality-specific biases by introducing modality-specific and modality-shared encoders, ensuring a clearer separation between modality-invariant and modality-specific representations. Experiments on three public datasets demonstrate that CG-DMER achieves state-of-the-art performance across diverse downstream tasks.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出CG-DMER框架，通过时空掩码建模和表征解耦对齐策略，解决多模态ECG解读中导联间时空依赖缺失和临床报告自由文本引入的模态偏差问题，在三个公开数据集上达到SOTA性能。
AI.motivation: 现有ECG-临床报告多模态方法存在两方面问题：(1)模态内：模型忽略导联间时空依赖，无法建模细粒度诊断模式；(2)模态间：直接对齐自由文本报告会引入模态特异性偏差，影响泛化能力。
AI.method: 提出CG-DMER对比生成框架，包含两个核心设计：1)时空掩码建模，通过在时空维度掩码并重建缺失信息来捕获细粒度时序动态和导联间空间依赖；2)表征解耦对齐策略，引入模态特定与模态共享编码器，分离模态不变与模态特异表征以减轻噪声和偏差。
AI.result: 在三个公开数据集上的实验表明，CG-DMER在多样化的下游任务中均达到当前最优性能。
AI.conclusion: 通过显式建模导联时空依赖和解耦模态表征，CG-DMER有效提升了多模态ECG表征学习的质量，为心血管疾病的精准诊断提供了更可靠的工具。

title: A Generalized Apprenticeship Learning Framework for Capturing Evolving Student Pedagogical Strategies
summary: Reinforcement Learning (RL) and Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) have advanced rapidly in recent years and have been successfully applied to e-learning environments like intelligent tutoring systems (ITSs). Despite great success, the broader application of DRL to educational technologies has been limited due to major challenges such as sample inefficiency and difficulty designing the reward function. In contrast, Apprenticeship Learning (AL) uses a few expert demonstrations to infer the expert's underlying reward functions and derive decision-making policies that generalize and replicate optimal behavior. In this work, we leverage a generalized AL framework, THEMES, to induce effective pedagogical policies by capturing the complexities of the expert student learning process, where multiple reward functions may dynamically evolve over time. We evaluate the effectiveness of THEMES against six state-of-the-art baselines, demonstrating its superior performance and highlighting its potential as a powerful alternative for inducing effective pedagogical policies and show that it can achieve high performance, with an AUC of 0.899 and a Jaccard of 0.653, using only 18 trajectories of a previous semester to predict student pedagogical decisions in a later semester.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出THEMES学徒学习框架，解决深度强化学习在教育技术中样本效率低和奖励函数设计困难的问题。框架通过捕捉学生专家学习过程中动态演变的多个奖励函数，仅用18个历史轨迹就能预测后续学期的教学决策，达到0.899 AUC和0.653 Jaccard指数，性能优于6种基线方法。
AI.motivation: 尽管强化学习（RL）和深度强化学习（DRL）已成功应用于智能辅导系统（ITSs），但样本效率低下和奖励函数设计困难限制了其在教育技术中的广泛应用。学徒学习（AL）可通过少量专家演示推断潜在奖励函数，为DRL提供了更有效的替代方案。
AI.method: 提出通用学徒学习框架THEMES，核心是捕捉学生专家学习过程的复杂性，特别处理多个奖励函数随时间动态演变的问题。该框架通过从少量演示中学习专家行为模式，推导出可推广的教学决策策略。
AI.result: 在预测学生教学决策任务中，THEMES显著优于六种先进基线方法。仅使用前一学期18个学习轨迹，就在后一学期的预测中达到0.899 AUC和0.653 Jaccard指数，证明其高样本效率下的强泛化能力。
AI.conclusion: THEMES为智能辅导系统提供了强有力的教学策略诱导方法，成功克服了DRL的主要局限性。其通过极少量演示实现高性能的特性，使该框架在教育技术实际应用中具备更高可行性和可扩展性。

title: NoRD: A Data-Efficient Vision-Language-Action Model that Drives without Reasoning
summary: Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models are advancing autonomous driving by replacing modular pipelines with unified end-to-end architectures. However, current VLAs face two expensive requirements: (1) massive dataset collection, and (2) dense reasoning annotations. In this work, we address both challenges with \modelname (\textbf{No} \textbf{R}easoning for \textbf{D}riving). Compared to existing VLAs, \modelname achieves competitive performance while being fine-tuned on $<$60\% of the data and no reasoning annotations, resulting in 3$\times$ fewer tokens. We identify that standard Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) fails to yield significant improvements when applied to policies trained on such small, reasoning-free datasets. We show that this limitation stems from difficulty bias, which disproportionately penalizes reward signals from scenarios that produce high-variance rollouts within GRPO. \modelname overcomes this by incorporating Dr.~GRPO, a recent algorithm designed to mitigate difficulty bias in LLMs. As a result, \modelname achieves competitive performance on Waymo and NAVSIM with a fraction of the training data and no reasoning overhead, enabling more efficient autonomous systems.

AI.tldr: 本文提出\modelname（No Reasoning for Driving），一种无需推理的自动驾驶视觉-语言-动作模型。该模型通过引入Dr. GRPO算法缓解难度偏置问题，在仅使用不足60%训练数据且完全摒弃推理标注的情况下，实现了与现有方法相当的性能，训练token减少3倍。
AI.motivation: 尽管视觉-语言-动作模型能统一自动驾驶的模块化流水线，但其依赖大规模数据采集和密集推理标注，导致极高的经济和计算成本。现有方法难以摆脱这一瓶颈，限制了自动驾驶技术的规模化部署。
AI.method: 1) 构建不含推理标注的小型训练数据集；2) 揭示标准GRPO算法在此类数据上失效的根源在于难度偏置——该偏置会不成比例地惩罚来自高方差场景的奖励信号；3) 集成Dr. GRPO算法，通过调整rollout权重来缓解难度偏置，从而在有限数据下有效优化策略。
AI.result: 在Waymo和NAVSIM基准测试中，\modelname仅使用60%以下的训练数据且无需任何推理标注，性能达到竞争水平，训练token消耗降低3倍，显著提升了自动驾驶系统的训练效率。
AI.conclusion: 本研究证明，通过精心设计优化算法以适配数据特性，可以在大幅减少数据依赖和推理开销的同时维持高性能。\modelname为开发更经济、高效的自动驾驶系统提供了可行路径，强调了算法创新与数据效率并重的重要性。

title: Memory-guided Prototypical Co-occurrence Learning for Mixed Emotion Recognition
summary: Emotion recognition from multi-modal physiological and behavioral signals plays a pivotal role in affective computing, yet most existing models remain constrained to the prediction of singular emotions in controlled laboratory settings. Real-world human emotional experiences, by contrast, are often characterized by the simultaneous presence of multiple affective states, spurring recent interest in mixed emotion recognition as an emotion distribution learning problem. Current approaches, however, often neglect the valence consistency and structured correlations inherent among coexisting emotions. To address this limitation, we propose a Memory-guided Prototypical Co-occurrence Learning (MPCL) framework that explicitly models emotion co-occurrence patterns. Specifically, we first fuse multi-modal signals via a multi-scale associative memory mechanism. To capture cross-modal semantic relationships, we construct emotion-specific prototype memory banks, yielding rich physiological and behavioral representations, and employ prototype relation distillation to ensure cross-modal alignment in the latent prototype space. Furthermore, inspired by human cognitive memory systems, we introduce a memory retrieval strategy to extract semantic-level co-occurrence associations across emotion categories. Through this bottom-up hierarchical abstraction process, our model learns affectively informative representations for accurate emotion distribution prediction. Comprehensive experiments on two public datasets demonstrate that MPCL consistently outperforms state-of-the-art methods in mixed emotion recognition, both quantitatively and qualitatively.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出记忆引导的原型共现学习（MPCL）框架，用于从多模态生理和行为信号中识别混合情绪。框架通过多尺度联想记忆融合信号，利用情绪原型记忆库和关系蒸馏实现跨模态对齐，并采用记忆检索策略挖掘情绪共现关联，最终在两个公开数据集上超越现有最优方法。
AI.motivation: 现有情绪识别模型局限于受控实验室中单一情绪预测，而现实情绪体验常为多种情感状态并存。当前混合情绪识别方法忽视了共现情绪间的效价一致性与结构化关联，限制了其实际应用效果。
AI.method: 提出MPCL框架，具体包括：通过多尺度联想记忆机制融合多模态信号；构建情绪特定原型记忆库捕获跨模态语义关系，并采用原型关系蒸馏确保潜在空间对齐；设计记忆检索策略提取情绪类别间的语义级共现关联；通过自下而上层次抽象过程学习情感信息丰富的表示。
AI.result: 在两个公开数据集上的全面实验表明，MPCL在定量指标和定性分析上均持续优于当前最先进方法，验证了所提框架在混合情绪识别任务中的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 该研究通过显式建模情绪共现模式，为多模态混合情绪识别提供了有效解决方案，展示了在情感计算领域的应用潜力，并为未来研究提供了新方向。

title: Aletheia tackles FirstProof autonomously
summary: We report the performance of Aletheia (Feng et al., 2026b), a mathematics research agent powered by Gemini 3 Deep Think, on the inaugural FirstProof challenge. Within the allowed timeframe of the challenge, Aletheia autonomously solved 6 problems (2, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10) out of 10 according to majority expert assessments; we note that experts were not unanimous on Problem 8 (only). For full transparency, we explain our interpretation of FirstProof and disclose details about our experiments as well as our evaluation. Raw prompts and outputs are available at https://github.com/google-deepmind/superhuman/tree/main/aletheia.

AI.tldr: 本文报道了由Gemini 3 Deep Think驱动的数学研究智能体Aletheia在首届FirstProof挑战赛中的表现。在限定时间内，Aletheia自主解决了10道题目中的6道（第2、5、7、8、9、10题），专家仅对第8题的解答存在分歧。论文详细阐述了研究背景、实验方法和评估过程，并公开了原始提示和输出以确保透明度。
AI.motivation: 数学研究智能体的开发旨在验证AI系统在复杂数学推理和证明任务中的能力。FirstProof挑战赛为评估这类智能体提供了标准化平台，本研究希望通过参与该挑战，检验Aletheia在真实数学研究场景中的表现，并推动数学AI领域的发展。
AI.method: 研究采用Gemini 3 Deep Think作为核心引擎，构建了名为Aletheia的数学研究智能体。通过设计特定的提示工程策略，让智能体自主处理FirstProof挑战赛中的数学问题。实验过程中记录了完整的交互日志，并邀请多位专家对解答结果进行独立评估，最终采用多数专家共识作为评判标准，仅第8题存在评估分歧。
AI.result: 在首届FirstProof挑战赛中，Aletheia在限定时间内成功解决了10道题目中的6道（第2、5、7、8、9、10题），解决率为60%。专家评估显示，除第8题外，其余5道题的解答均获得一致认可。该结果展示了AI系统在数学推理领域的显著进步，同时也揭示了当前技术在处理某些复杂数学问题时的局限性。
AI.conclusion: 本研究证明，基于Gemini 3 Deep Think的Aletheia智能体已具备解决真实数学挑战问题的能力，在FirstProof挑战中达到了令人瞩目的水平。论文强调透明度和可重复性的重要性，公开了所有原始数据和代码。未来工作将致力于提升智能体在更复杂数学问题上的表现，并进一步优化评估机制以达成专家共识。

title: Multimodal Multi-Agent Empowered Legal Judgment Prediction
comment: Accepted to the IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech, and Signal Processing (ICASSP) 2026
summary: Legal Judgment Prediction (LJP) aims to predict the outcomes of legal cases based on factual descriptions, serving as a fundamental task to advance the development of legal systems. Traditional methods often rely on statistical analyses or role-based simulations but face challenges with multiple allegations, diverse evidence, and lack adaptability. In this paper, we introduce JurisMMA, a novel framework for LJP that effectively decomposes trial tasks, standardizes processes, and organizes them into distinct stages. Furthermore, we build JurisMM, a large dataset with over 100,000 recent Chinese judicial records, including both text and multimodal video-text data, enabling comprehensive evaluation. Experiments on JurisMM and the benchmark LawBench validate our framework's effectiveness. These results indicate that our framework is effective not only for LJP but also for a broader range of legal applications, offering new perspectives for the development of future legal methods and datasets.

AI.tldr: 针对传统法律判决预测方法在多指控、多样证据和适应性方面的局限，本文提出JurisMMA框架，通过分解审判任务、标准化流程来提升预测效果，并构建包含10万+中国司法记录的多模态数据集JurisMM。实验证实该框架在法律判决预测及更广泛法律应用中具有有效性。
AI.motivation: 法律判决预测是推进法律系统发展的基础任务。传统方法依赖统计分析或角色模拟，但面临多重指控、证据多样性和适应性不足等挑战，亟需更高效的解决方案。
AI.method: 提出JurisMMA框架，将审判任务分解、流程标准化并分阶段组织。同时构建JurisMM大规模数据集，包含10万+中国司法记录，整合文本与多模态视频-文本数据，以支持全面评估。
AI.result: 在JurisMM和LawBench基准上的实验验证了JurisMMA框架的有效性。结果表明，该框架不仅适用于法律判决预测，还可推广至更广泛的法律应用场景。
AI.conclusion: JurisMMA框架在法律判决预测任务中表现优异，并具有扩展到其他法律应用的潜力，为未来法律AI方法和数据集构建提供了新思路。

title: Sample-efficient evidence estimation of score based priors for model selection
summary: The choice of prior is central to solving ill-posed imaging inverse problems, making it essential to select one consistent with the measurements $y$ to avoid severe bias. In Bayesian inverse problems, this could be achieved by evaluating the model evidence $p(y \mid M)$ under different models $M$ that specify the prior and then selecting the one with the highest value. Diffusion models are the state-of-the-art approach to solving inverse problems with a data-driven prior; however, directly computing the model evidence with respect to a diffusion prior is intractable. Furthermore, most existing model evidence estimators require either many pointwise evaluations of the unnormalized prior density or an accurate clean prior score. We propose \method, an estimator of the model evidence of a diffusion prior by integrating over the time-marginals of posterior sampling methods. Our method leverages the large amount of intermediate samples naturally obtained during the reverse diffusion sampling process to obtain an accurate estimation of the model evidence using only a handful of posterior samples (e.g., 20). We also demonstrate how to implement our estimator in tandem with recent diffusion posterior sampling methods. Empirically, our estimator matches the model evidence when it can be computed analytically, and it is able to both select the correct diffusion model prior and diagnose prior misfit under different highly ill-conditioned, non-linear inverse problems, including a real-world black hole imaging problem.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种扩散模型先验的模型证据估计方法，通过整合后验采样过程的时间边缘分布，巧妙利用反向扩散产生的大量中间样本，仅需少量后验样本（如20个）即可准确估计模型证据，解决了病态成像逆问题中先验选择的关键难题。
AI.motivation: 在贝叶斯逆问题中，先验选择对避免严重偏差至关重要，理想策略是计算不同先验模型M下的模型证据p(y|M)并选取最大值。尽管扩散模型作为数据驱动先验处于领先地位，但其模型证据直接计算不可行。现有估计器需大量未归一化先验密度的点态评估或精确干净先验分数，限制了实际应用。
AI.method: 所提方法通过积分后验采样的时间边缘分布来估计扩散先验的模型证据。其核心是利用反向扩散采样过程自然产生的大量中间样本，仅需少量最终后验样本（例如20个）即可获得精确估计，并可与现有扩散后验采样方法无缝结合。
AI.result: 实验表明：该估计器在模型证据可解析计算时结果一致；能正确选择扩散模型先验；在多种高度病态、非线性逆问题（包括真实黑洞成像问题）中有效诊断先验失配，展现出高精度与高实用性。
AI.conclusion: 该方法为扩散先验下的模型证据估计提供了高效准确的解决方案，突破了计算复杂度与精度瓶颈，为病态成像逆问题中的先验选择提供了实用工具，在理论方法与现实应用间建立了有效桥梁。

title: GENSR: Symbolic Regression Based in Equation Generative Space
summary: Symbolic Regression (SR) tries to reveal the hidden equations behind observed data. However, most methods search within a discrete equation space, where the structural modifications of equations rarely align with their numerical behavior, leaving fitting error feedback too noisy to guide exploration. To address this challenge, we propose GenSR, a generative latent space-based SR framework following the `map construction -> coarse localization -> fine search'' paradigm. Specifically, GenSR first pretrains a dual-branch Conditional Variational Autoencoder (CVAE) to reparameterize symbolic equations into a generative latent space with symbolic continuity and local numerical smoothness. This space can be regarded as a well-structured `map'' of the equation space, providing directional signals for search. At inference, the CVAE coarsely localizes the input data to promising regions in the latent space. Then, a modified CMA-ES refines the candidate region, leveraging smooth latent gradients. From a Bayesian perspective, GenSR reframes the SR task as maximizing the conditional distribution $p(\mathrm{Equ.} \mid \mathrm{Num.})$, with CVAE training achieving this objective through the Evidence Lower Bound (ELBO). This new perspective provides a theoretical guarantee for the effectiveness of GenSR. Extensive experiments show that GenSR jointly optimizes predictive accuracy, expression simplicity, and computational efficiency, while remaining robust under noise.

AI.tldr: 传统符号回归在离散方程空间中搜索，结构修改与数值行为不匹配导致误差反馈噪声大。为此，本文提出GenSR生成式潜空间框架，遵循'地图构建→粗定位→精细搜索'流程：预训练双分支CVAE构建符号连续且数值平滑的潜空间地图；推理时先粗定位再通过改进CMA-ES利用平滑梯度精细搜索；从贝叶斯视角最大化p(公式|数值)，提供理论保证。实验表明该方法联合优化精度、简洁性与效率，且对噪声鲁棒。
AI.motivation: 传统符号回归方法在离散方程空间中搜索时，方程的结构修改往往与数值行为变化不一致，导致拟合误差反馈过于噪声化，无法有效指导搜索过程。
AI.method: 提出GenSR框架，采用'地图构建→粗定位→精细搜索'三阶段范式。首先，预训练一个双分支条件变分自编码器(CVAE)，将符号方程重新参数化为具有符号连续性和局部数值平滑性的生成式潜空间，该空间可作为方程空间的良好结构化'地图'。在推理阶段，CVAE先将输入数据粗定位到潜空间中的有希望区域，然后采用改进的CMA-ES算法利用平滑的潜空间梯度进行精细搜索。理论层面，从贝叶斯角度将符号回归任务重新表述为最大化条件分布p(公式|数值)，CVAE训练通过证据下界(ELBO)实现该目标，为方法有效性提供理论保证。
AI.result: 在广泛实验中，GenSR展现出联合优化预测准确性、表达式简洁性和计算效率的能力，同时在噪声条件下保持较强的鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: GenSR通过构建生成式潜空间，为符号回归提供了新的理论框架和实现路径，有效解决了传统离散搜索方法中的噪声问题，实现了精度、简洁性和效率的协同优化，具有理论和实践价值。

title: SELAUR: Self Evolving LLM Agent via Uncertainty-aware Rewards
summary: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed as multi-step decision-making agents, where effective reward design is essential for guiding learning. Although recent work explores various forms of reward shaping and step-level credit assignment, a key signal remains largely overlooked: the intrinsic uncertainty of LLMs. Uncertainty reflects model confidence, reveals where exploration is needed, and offers valuable learning cues even in failed trajectories. We introduce SELAUR: Self Evolving LLM Agent via Uncertainty-aware Rewards, a reinforcement learning framework that incorporates uncertainty directly into the reward design. SELAUR integrates entropy-, least-confidence-, and margin-based metrics into a combined token-level uncertainty estimate, providing dense confidence-aligned supervision, and employs a failure-aware reward reshaping mechanism that injects these uncertainty signals into step- and trajectory-level rewards to improve exploration efficiency and learning stability. Experiments on two benchmarks, ALFWorld and WebShop, show that our method consistently improves success rates over strong baselines. Ablation studies further demonstrate how uncertainty signals enhance exploration and robustness.

AI.tldr: SELAUR是一个基于不确定性感知奖励的LLM智能体强化学习框架。它通过融合熵、最小置信度和间隔度量来估计token级不确定性，并提供密集置信对齐监督；同时采用失败感知奖励重塑机制，将不确定性信号注入步骤和轨迹级奖励中，以提升探索效率和稳定性。在ALFWorld和WebShop基准测试中，该方法显著优于基线模型。
AI.motivation: 现有研究在LLM智能体的奖励设计和步骤级信用分配方面已有探索，但普遍忽视了模型的不确定性这一关键信号。不确定性能够反映模型置信度、指示探索需求，并为失败轨迹提供宝贵的学习线索。缺乏对不确定性的利用限制了智能体在多步决策中的探索效率和鲁棒性。
AI.method: SELAUR框架主要包含两个核心组件：1）不确定性估计模块，结合熵、最小置信度和间隔三种度量构建token级综合不确定性评估，提供密集置信对齐监督；2）失败感知奖励重塑机制，将不确定性信号注入步骤级和轨迹级奖励中。具体通过动态调整奖励信号，在模型高不确定性区域增强探索，在低不确定性区域利用已有知识，从而提升学习稳定性和效率。
AI.result: 在ALFWorld和WebShop两个基准测试上，SELAUR相比强基线模型取得了持续的成功率提升。消融实验验证了不确定性信号的有效性：熵、最小置信度和间隔三种度量的组合显著增强了探索能力；失败感知奖励重塑机制提高了学习稳定性；不确定性注入策略有效提升了模型在复杂多步任务中的鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: 本研究首次系统地将LLM不确定性引入智能体奖励设计中，证明了不确定性作为一种内在学习信号的重要价值。SELAUR框架通过不确定性感知奖励机制，有效解决了多步决策中的探索效率和学习稳定性问题，为未来LLM智能体训练提供了新范式。该方法在复杂交互任务中具有广泛应用前景。

title: Learning from Trials and Errors: Reflective Test-Time Planning for Embodied LLMs
summary: Embodied LLMs endow robots with high-level task reasoning, but they cannot reflect on what went wrong or why, turning deployment into a sequence of independent trials where mistakes repeat rather than accumulate into experience. Drawing upon human reflective practitioners, we introduce Reflective Test-Time Planning, which integrates two modes of reflection: \textit{reflection-in-action}, where the agent uses test-time scaling to generate and score multiple candidate actions using internal reflections before execution; and \textit{reflection-on-action}, which uses test-time training to update both its internal reflection model and its action policy based on external reflections after execution. We also include retrospective reflection, allowing the agent to re-evaluate earlier decisions and perform model updates with hindsight for proper long-horizon credit assignment. Experiments on our newly-designed Long-Horizon Household benchmark and MuJoCo Cupboard Fitting benchmark show significant gains over baseline models, with ablative studies validating the complementary roles of reflection-in-action and reflection-on-action. Qualitative analyses, including real-robot trials, highlight behavioral correction through reflection.

AI.tldr: 针对具身LLM机器人缺乏反思能力、错误重复的问题，提出反思测试时规划，整合行动中反思（预执行多动作评分）、行动后反思（后执行模型更新）和回顾性反思（事后信用分配），在长期家务和MuJoCo基准测试中显著提升性能。
AI.motivation: 现有具身大语言模型虽具高级推理能力，但无法反思错误根源，导致机器人部署成为独立试错序列，经验无法累积。借鉴人类反思实践者，亟需赋予机器人从错误中学习、实现经验积累的能力。
AI.method: 提出反思测试时规划框架，包含：1）行动中反思：测试时缩放生成并评分多候选动作；2）行动后反思：基于外部反馈测试时训练更新反思模型和动作策略；3）回顾性反思：事后重评估早期决策实现长期信用分配。在Long-Horizon Household和MuJoCo Cupboard Fitting基准上验证。
AI.result: 在新设计的长期家务基准和MuJoCo橱柜安装基准上显著优于基线模型，消融研究证实行动中反思和行动后反思的互补作用，真实机器人试验显示反思能修正行为。
AI.conclusion: 该方法使机器人具备从错误中学习和经验积累能力，为具身智能持续学习提供新范式，三种反思机制协同有效提升长期任务性能。

title: Is the Trigger Essential? A Feature-Based Triggerless Backdoor Attack in Vertical Federated Learning
summary: As a distributed collaborative machine learning paradigm, vertical federated learning (VFL) allows multiple passive parties with distinct features and one active party with labels to collaboratively train a model. Although it is known for the privacy-preserving capabilities, VFL still faces significant privacy and security threats from backdoor attacks. Existing backdoor attacks typically involve an attacker implanting a trigger into the model during the training phase and executing the attack by adding the trigger to the samples during the inference phase. However, in this paper, we find that triggers are not essential for backdoor attacks in VFL. In light of this, we disclose a new backdoor attack pathway in VFL by introducing a feature-based triggerless backdoor attack. This attack operates under a more stringent security assumption, where the attacker is honest-but-curious rather than malicious during the training phase. It comprises three modules: label inference for the targeted backdoor attack, poison generation with amplification and perturbation mechanisms, and backdoor execution to implement the attack. Extensive experiments on five benchmark datasets demonstrate that our attack outperforms three baseline backdoor attacks by 2 to 50 times while minimally impacting the main task. Even in VFL scenarios with 32 passive parties and only one set of auxiliary data, our attack maintains high performance. Moreover, when confronted with distinct defense strategies, our attack remains largely unaffected and exhibits strong robustness. We hope that the disclosure of this triggerless backdoor attack pathway will encourage the community to revisit security threats in VFL scenarios and inspire researchers to develop more robust and practical defense strategies.

AI.tldr: 本文针对垂直联邦学习(VFL)提出了一种新型特征基无触发器后门攻击。在诚实但好奇的安全假设下，该攻击通过标签推断、带放大与扰动机制的投毒生成及后门执行三模块，实现了较基线攻击2-50倍的性能提升，且对主任务影响极小，面对防御策略展现强鲁棒性，揭示了VFL安全的新威胁路径。
AI.motivation: 尽管垂直联邦学习以隐私保护著称，但仍面临后门攻击威胁。现有攻击依赖触发器，但其在VFL中的必要性尚未被质疑。为揭示更隐蔽的攻击方式并推动VFL安全防御研究，本文探索了一种无需触发器的新型后门攻击路径。
AI.method: 提出基于特征的无触发器后门攻击框架，包含三个核心模块：(1)针对目标样本的标签推断模块；(2)采用放大和扰动机制生成投毒样本的模块；(3)后门执行模块。攻击者遵循诚实但好奇的安全假设，即在训练阶段不恶意破坏协议但可在推理阶段实施攻击。
AI.result: 在五个基准数据集上的实验表明：该攻击成功率较三种基线方法提升2-50倍；对主任务准确率影响极低；在32个被动参与方且仅有一组辅助数据的极端场景下仍保持高效；面对多种防御策略表现出强鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: 本研究揭示了VFL中无触发器后门攻击的新途径，证明触发器在VFL后门攻击中并非必要。作者希望该发现能促使学术界重新审视VFL安全威胁，并推动开发更鲁棒、实用的防御机制。

title: QEDBENCH: Quantifying the Alignment Gap in Automated Evaluation of University-Level Mathematical Proofs
summary: As Large Language Models (LLMs) saturate elementary benchmarks, the research frontier has shifted from generation to the reliability of automated evaluation. We demonstrate that standard "LLM-as-a-Judge" protocols suffer from a systematic Alignment Gap when applied to upper-undergraduate to early graduate level mathematics. To quantify this, we introduce QEDBench, the first large-scale dual-rubric alignment benchmark to systematically measure alignment with human experts on university-level math proofs by contrasting course-specific rubrics against expert common knowledge criteria. By deploying a dual-evaluation matrix (7 judges x 5 solvers) against 1,000+ hours of human evaluation, we reveal that certain frontier evaluators like Claude Opus 4.5, DeepSeek-V3, Qwen 2.5 Max, and Llama 4 Maverick exhibit significant positive bias (up to +0.18, +0.20, +0.30, +0.36 mean score inflation, respectively). Furthermore, we uncover a critical reasoning gap in the discrete domain: while Gemini 3.0 Pro achieves state-of-the-art performance (0.91 average human evaluation score), other reasoning models like GPT-5 Pro and Claude Sonnet 4.5 see their performance significantly degrade in discrete domains. Specifically, their average human evaluation scores drop to 0.72 and 0.63 in Discrete Math, and to 0.74 and 0.50 in Graph Theory. In addition to these research results, we also release QEDBench as a public benchmark for evaluating and improving AI judges. Our benchmark is publicly published at https://github.com/qqliu/Yale-QEDBench.

AI.tldr: 本文揭示了LLM-as-a-Judge在高等数学评估中的系统性对齐差距，推出了首个大规模双标准对齐基准QEDBench，发现前沿评判模型存在显著正偏差，并在离散数学领域发现关键推理差距。
AI.motivation: 随着大语言模型在基础基准测试中趋于饱和，研究前沿转向自动化评估的可靠性问题。现有LLM-as-a-Judge协议在高等教育数学评估中存在系统性对齐差距，缺乏有效评估AI评判与专家判断对齐程度的基准。
AI.method: 开发了QEDBench基准，通过对比课程特定评分标准与专家常识标准，构建7个评判模型×5个求解器的双评估矩阵，基于1000+小时的人类评估数据，系统测量AI评判与数学专家的对齐程度。
AI.result: 发现Claude Opus 4.5、DeepSeek-V3、Qwen 2.5 Max和Llama 4 Maverick等前沿评判模型存在显著正偏差（平均分数虚高分别达+0.18、+0.20、+0.30、+0.36）；揭示离散领域的关键推理差距，如GPT-5 Pro和Claude Sonnet 4.5在离散数学中评分分别降至0.72和0.63，在图论中分别降至0.74和0.50，而Gemini 3.0 Pro保持0.91的顶尖水平。
AI.conclusion: 证实LLM-as-a-Judge在高等教育数学评估中存在严重对齐问题，发布QEDBench作为公开基准以推动AI评判模型的发展和改进，为研究社区提供评估工具。

title: TrajGPT-R: Generating Urban Mobility Trajectory with Reinforcement Learning-Enhanced Generative Pre-trained Transformer
comment: TrajGPT-R is a Reinforcement Learning-Enhanced Generative Pre-trained Transformer for Mobility Trajectory Generation
summary: Mobility trajectories are essential for understanding urban dynamics and enhancing urban planning, yet access to such data is frequently hindered by privacy concerns. This research introduces a transformative framework for generating large-scale urban mobility trajectories, employing a novel application of a transformer-based model pre-trained and fine-tuned through a two-phase process. Initially, trajectory generation is conceptualized as an offline reinforcement learning (RL) problem, with a significant reduction in vocabulary space achieved during tokenization. The integration of Inverse Reinforcement Learning (IRL) allows for the capture of trajectory-wise reward signals, leveraging historical data to infer individual mobility preferences. Subsequently, the pre-trained model is fine-tuned using the constructed reward model, effectively addressing the challenges inherent in traditional RL-based autoregressive methods, such as long-term credit assignment and handling of sparse reward environments. Comprehensive evaluations on multiple datasets illustrate that our framework markedly surpasses existing models in terms of reliability and diversity. Our findings not only advance the field of urban mobility modeling but also provide a robust methodology for simulating urban data, with significant implications for traffic management and urban development planning. The implementation is publicly available at https://github.com/Wangjw6/TrajGPT_R.

AI.tldr: 针对隐私问题导致的城市移动轨迹数据获取困难，本文提出一种基于Transformer的两阶段预训练-微调框架。通过将轨迹生成建模为离线强化学习问题并引入逆向强化学习（IRL）捕捉轨迹级奖励信号，有效解决了长期信用分配和稀疏奖励挑战。多数据集评估显示，该框架在可靠性和多样性上显著优于现有模型。
AI.motivation: 城市移动轨迹对于理解城市动态和优化城市规划至关重要，但隐私问题严重限制了此类数据的获取。为此，本文旨在开发一种能够生成大规模城市移动轨迹的变革性框架，以支持交通管理和城市发展决策。
AI.method: 本文提出一种基于Transformer的两阶段预训练-微调框架。首先，将轨迹生成概念化为离线强化学习问题，并在tokenization过程中大幅缩减词汇空间。其次，集成逆向强化学习（IRL）从历史数据中推断个体移动偏好，构建轨迹级奖励信号。最后，利用该奖励模型对预训练模型进行微调，有效解决传统RL基自回归方法在长期信用分配和稀疏奖励环境处理中的固有挑战。
AI.result: 在多个数据集上的全面评估表明，该框架在轨迹生成的可靠性和多样性指标上显著超越现有模型。
AI.conclusion: 本研究不仅推动了城市移动建模领域的发展，还提供了一种鲁棒的城市数据模拟方法，对交通管理和城市规划具有重要实践意义。

title: UrbanFM: Scaling Urban Spatio-Temporal Foundation Models
summary: Urban systems, as dynamic complex systems, continuously generate spatio-temporal data streams that encode the fundamental laws of human mobility and city evolution. While AI for Science has witnessed the transformative power of foundation models in disciplines like genomics and meteorology, urban computing remains fragmented due to "scenario-specific" models, which are overfitted to specific regions or tasks, hindering their generalizability. To bridge this gap and advance spatio-temporal foundation models for urban systems, we adopt scaling as the central perspective and systematically investigate two key questions: what to scale and how to scale. Grounded in first-principles analysis, we identify three critical dimensions: heterogeneity, correlation, and dynamics, aligning these principles with the fundamental scientific properties of urban spatio-temporal data. Specifically, to address heterogeneity through data scaling, we construct WorldST. This billion-scale corpus standardizes diverse physical signals, such as traffic flow and speed, from over 100 global cities into a unified data format. To enable computation scaling for modeling correlations, we introduce the MiniST unit, a novel split mechanism that discretizes continuous spatio-temporal fields into learnable computational units to unify representations of grid-based and sensor-based observations. Finally, addressing dynamics via architecture scaling, we propose UrbanFM, a minimalist self-attention architecture designed with limited inductive biases to autonomously learn dynamic spatio-temporal dependencies from massive data. Furthermore, we establish EvalST, the largest-scale urban spatio-temporal benchmark to date. Extensive experiments demonstrate that UrbanFM achieves remarkable zero-shot generalization across unseen cities and tasks, marking a pivotal first step toward large-scale urban spatio-temporal foundation models.

AI.tldr: 针对城市计算碎片化问题，本文从数据、计算、架构三维度系统扩展：构建WorldST十亿级语料库、MiniST标准化计算单元和UrbanFM极简自注意力模型，并建立EvalST基准。实验显示UrbanFM实现跨城市跨任务零样本泛化，标志着城市时空基础模型研究的重大突破。
AI.motivation: 当前城市计算领域模型多为"场景特定"型，过度拟合特定区域或任务，导致泛化能力受限。虽然AI for Science在基因组学、气象学等领域通过基础模型展现出变革性力量，但城市时空基础模型的研究仍存在空白。这种碎片化现状阻碍了城市系统普适性规律的发现和应用。
AI.method: 基于第一性原理分析，识别出异质性、相关性和动态性三个关键维度，提出对应的三维扩展框架：1) 数据扩展：构建WorldST十亿级语料库，标准化100多个全球城市的交通流、速度等物理信号，解决数据异质性问题；2) 计算扩展：设计MiniST分割机制，将连续时空场离散化为可学习计算单元，统一网格与传感器观测以建模相关性；3) 架构扩展：开发UrbanFM极简自注意力架构，通过有限归纳偏置从海量数据自主学习目标时空依赖，应对动态性挑战。同时建立EvalST大规模基准用于评估。
AI.result: 大规模实验表明，UrbanFM在未见过的城市和任务上均能实现显著零样本泛化性能，验证了三维扩展策略在构建城市时空基础模型方面的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 本研究通过数据、计算、架构三维度的系统性扩展，成功构建了首个城市时空基础模型UrbanFM，其零样本泛化能力证明了通用城市智能模型的可行性。该工作为城市计算领域从碎片化范式向基础模型范式转变奠定了关键基石，为未来大规模、普适性城市研究开辟了新方向。

title: High-Dimensional Robust Mean Estimation with Untrusted Batches
summary:
We study high-dimensional mean estimation in a collaborative setting where data is contributed by $N$ users in batches of size $n$. In this environment, a learner seeks to recover the mean $μ$ of a true distribution $P$ from a collection of sources that are both statistically heterogeneous and potentially malicious. We formalize this challenge through a double corruption landscape: an $\varepsilon$-fraction of users are entirely adversarial, while the remaining ``good'' users provide data from distributions that are related to $P$, but deviate by a proximity parameter $α$.
  Unlike existing work on the untrusted batch model, which typically measures this deviation via total variation distance in discrete settings, we address the continuous, high-dimensional regime under two natural variants for deviation: (1) good batches are drawn from distributions with a mean-shift of $\sqrtα$, or (2) an $α$-fraction of samples within each good batch are adversarially corrupted. In particular, the second model presents significant new challenges: in high dimensions, unlike discrete settings, even a small fraction of sample-level corruption can shift empirical means and covariances arbitrarily.
  We provide two Sum-of-Squares (SoS) based algorithms to navigate this tiered corruption. Our algorithms achieve the minimax-optimal error rate $O(\sqrt{\varepsilon/n} + \sqrt{d/nN} + \sqrtα)$, demonstrating that while heterogeneity $α$ represents an inherent statistical difficulty, the influence of adversarial users is suppressed by a factor of $1/\sqrt{n}$ due to the internal averaging afforded by the batch structure.

AI.tldr: 该论文研究了在存在双重腐败的协作学习环境中，N个用户各提供n个样本的批次数据，目标是估计高维分布的均值。提出了基于Sum-of-Squares的算法，在对抗性用户比例ε和统计异质性参数α的双重挑战下，达到了极小化最大最优误差率O(√(ε/n) + √(d/nN) + √α)。
AI.motivation: 现有不可信批处理模型主要关注离散设置下的总变差距离偏差，但连续高维场景中样本级腐败会任意扭曲统计量。现实协作学习中既存在恶意用户，也存在因数据分布差异导致的统计异质性，该研究旨在解决这两种腐败共存时的均值估计问题，这对实际应用中的鲁棒机器学习至关重要。
AI.method: 提出了两种基于Sum-of-Squares (SoS) 证明系统的半定规划算法。针对两种异质性模型：(1) 良好批次均值偏移√α；(2) 良好批次内α比例样本被对抗性腐败。算法利用SoS层次结构在高维空间中过滤异常数据并估计真实分布的一阶矩。
AI.result: 算法实现了极小化最大最优误差界O(√(ε/n) + √(d/nN) + √α)。关键发现是：统计异质性α构成固有统计难度，但对抗性用户的影响因批次内平均效应被1/√n因子抑制；即使在高维情况下，少量样本腐败的破坏性也可通过算法设计得到控制。
AI.conclusion: 该工作建立了高维协作学习的双重腐败理论框架，证明了SoS算法能有效应对统计异质性与对抗性攻击的复合挑战。批处理结构是缓解对抗性影响的关键机制，为设计鲁棒分布式学习系统提供了理论基础。异质性α无法消除，但对抗性腐败的影响可通过批次设计显著降低。

title: Fuz-RL: A Fuzzy-Guided Robust Framework for Safe Reinforcement Learning under Uncertainty
summary: Safe Reinforcement Learning (RL) is crucial for achieving high performance while ensuring safety in real-world applications. However, the complex interplay of multiple uncertainty sources in real environments poses significant challenges for interpretable risk assessment and robust decision-making. To address these challenges, we propose Fuz-RL, a fuzzy measure-guided robust framework for safe RL. Specifically, our framework develops a novel fuzzy Bellman operator for estimating robust value functions using Choquet integrals. Theoretically, we prove that solving the Fuz-RL problem (in Constrained Markov Decision Process (CMDP) form) is equivalent to solving distributionally robust safe RL problems (in robust CMDP form), effectively avoiding min-max optimization. Empirical analyses on safe-control-gym and safety-gymnasium scenarios demonstrate that Fuz-RL effectively integrates with existing safe RL baselines in a model-free manner, significantly improving both safety and control performance under various types of uncertainties in observation, action, and dynamics.

AI.tldr: 本文提出Fuz-RL，一种基于模糊测度的鲁棒安全强化学习框架。该框架通过新颖的模糊贝尔曼算子和Choquet积分来估计鲁棒值函数，理论证明了求解Fuz-RL等价于求解分布鲁棒安全RL问题，避免了min-max优化。在safe-control-gym和safety-gymnasium上的实验表明，该框架能以无模型方式与现有安全RL基线有效结合，在各类观测、动作和动态不确定性下显著提升安全性和控制性能。
AI.motivation: 在实际应用中，安全强化学习需要在保证安全的同时实现高性能，但真实环境中多源不确定性给可解释的风险评估和鲁棒决策带来了重大挑战。传统方法难以有效处理这种复杂性。
AI.method: 提出Fuz-RL框架，开发基于Choquet积分的模糊贝尔曼算子来估计鲁棒值函数。理论证明在约束马尔可夫决策过程(CMDP)形式下求解Fuz-RL等价于求解分布鲁棒安全RL问题，从而避免了计算复杂的min-max优化。
AI.result: 在safe-control-gym和safety-gymnasium基准测试中，Fuz-RL能以无模型方式无缝集成到现有安全RL基线中，在观测、动作和系统动力学不确定性条件下，显著提升了安全性和控制性能。
AI.conclusion: Fuz-RL框架通过模糊测度理论有效解决了多源不确定性下的安全强化学习问题，提供了理论保证和实践有效性，为安全关键应用提供了新的解决方案。

title: Transcoder Adapters for Reasoning-Model Diffing
comment: 9 pages main, 27 pages total, 10 figures. Code and visualizations at https://transcoder-adapters.github.io/
summary: While reasoning models are increasingly ubiquitous, the effects of reasoning training on a model's internal mechanisms remain poorly understood. In this work, we introduce transcoder adapters, a technique for learning an interpretable approximation of the difference in MLP computation before and after fine-tuning. We apply transcoder adapters to characterize the differences between Qwen2.5-Math-7B and its reasoning-distilled variant, DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-7B. Learned adapters are faithful to the target model's internal computation and next-token predictions. When evaluated on reasoning benchmarks, adapters match the reasoning model's response lengths and typically recover 50-90% of the accuracy gains from reasoning fine-tuning. Adapter features are sparsely activating and interpretable. When examining adapter features, we find that only ~8% have activating examples directly related to reasoning behaviors. We deeply study one such behavior -- the production of hesitation tokens (e.g., "wait"). Using attribution graphs, we trace hesitation to only ~2.4% of adapter features (5.6k total) performing one of two functions. These features are necessary and sufficient for producing hesitation tokens; removing them reduces response length, often without affecting accuracy. Overall, our results provide insight into reasoning training and suggest transcoder adapters may be useful for studying fine-tuning more broadly.

AI.tldr: 本文提出transcoder adapters技术，用于学习模型微调前后MLP计算差异的可解释近似。通过比较Qwen2.5-Math-7B及其推理蒸馏变体DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-7B，发现适配器能忠实复现模型内部计算，在推理基准测试中恢复50-90%的准确率提升，并揭示了仅少数特征与推理行为直接相关。
AI.motivation: 当前对推理训练如何影响模型内部机制的理解仍不充分。
AI.method: 设计transcoder adapters来近似微调前后的MLP计算差异，并应用于Qwen2.5-Math-7B与DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-7B的对比分析，利用归因图追踪关键行为特征。
AI.result: 适配器能匹配推理模型的响应长度，恢复50-90%的准确率提升，且特征稀疏激活、可解释。仅约8%特征与推理行为直接相关，其中产生犹豫标记的行为仅由2.4%特征执行，移除这些特征会缩短响应长度但通常不影响准确率。
AI.conclusion: 该研究为理解推理训练提供了新视角，并证明transcoder adapters是研究微调机制的通用有用工具。

title: From Isolation to Integration: Building an Adaptive Expert Forest for Pre-Trained Model-based Class-Incremental Learning
summary: Class-Incremental Learning (CIL) requires models to learn new classes without forgetting old ones. A common method is to freeze a pre-trained model and train a new, lightweight adapter for each task. While this prevents forgetting, it treats the learned knowledge as a simple, unstructured collection and fails to use the relationships between tasks. To this end, we propose the Semantic-guided Adaptive Expert Forest (SAEF), a new method that organizes adapters into a structured hierarchy for better knowledge sharing. SAEF first groups tasks into conceptual clusters based on their semantic relationships. Then, within each cluster, it builds a balanced expert tree by creating new adapters from merging the adapters of similar tasks. At inference time, SAEF finds and activates a set of relevant experts from the forest for any given input. The final prediction is made by combining the outputs of these activated experts, weighted by how confident each expert is. Experiments on several benchmark datasets show that SAEF achieves SOTA performance.

AI.tldr: 本文提出语义引导的自适应专家森林方法，通过语义聚类和专家树结构解决增量学习中的知识共享问题，在基准数据集上达到最优性能。
AI.motivation: 现有增量学习方法通过冻结预训练模型并添加轻量适配器防止遗忘，但将知识视为非结构化集合，未能利用任务间的语义关系，限制知识共享能力。
AI.method: 提出语义引导的自适应专家森林：基于语义关系将任务分组为概念聚类；在每个聚类内通过合并相似任务适配器构建平衡专家树；推理时激活相关专家并按置信度加权融合输出。
AI.result: 在多个基准数据集上的实验表明，该方法取得了当前最优性能。
AI.conclusion: 该方法通过构建结构化专家森林，有效利用任务间语义关系进行知识共享，显著提升了类增量学习性能。

title: Hierarchic-EEG2Text: Assessing EEG-To-Text Decoding across Hierarchical Abstraction Levels
summary:
An electroencephalogram (EEG) records the spatially averaged electrical activity of neurons in the brain, measured from the human scalp. Prior studies have explored EEG-based classification of objects or concepts, often for passive viewing of briefly presented image or video stimuli, with limited classes. Because EEG exhibits a low signal-to-noise ratio, recognizing fine-grained representations across a large number of classes remains challenging; however, abstract-level object representations may exist. In this work, we investigate whether EEG captures object representations across multiple hierarchical levels, and propose episodic analysis, in which a Machine Learning (ML) model is evaluated across various, yet related, classification tasks (episodes). Unlike prior episodic EEG studies that rely on fixed or randomly sampled classes of equal cardinality, we adopt hierarchy-aware episode sampling using WordNet to generate episodes with variable classes of diverse hierarchy. We also present the largest episodic framework in the EEG domain for detecting observed text from EEG signals in the PEERS dataset, comprising $931538$ EEG samples under $1610$ object labels, acquired from $264$ human participants (subjects) performing controlled cognitive tasks, enabling the study of neural dynamics underlying perception, decision-making, and performance monitoring.
  We examine how the semantic abstraction level affects classification performance across multiple learning techniques and architectures, providing a comprehensive analysis. The models tend to improve performance when the classification categories are drawn from higher levels of the hierarchy, suggesting sensitivity to abstraction. Our work highlights abstraction depth as an underexplored dimension of EEG decoding and motivates future research in this direction.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过基于WordNet的分层感知片段采样方法，在包含264名受试者、931,538个EEG样本的PEERS数据集上，系统探究了EEG信号在不同语义抽象层级上的物体表征能力，发现分类性能随层级抽象程度提高而提升，揭示了抽象深度是EEG解码中一个亟待探索的重要维度。
AI.motivation: 由于EEG信号信噪比低，细粒度多类别物体分类面临挑战，但抽象层级的表征可能更易解码。现有研究多局限于少量类别或被动观看任务，缺乏对EEG表征层次结构的系统性探索，限制了神经解码技术的发展。
AI.method: 提出片段分析方法，采用基于WordNet的分层感知采样策略生成具有多样层级结构的分类任务片段，并在大规模PEERS数据集（264名受试者、1610个物体标签、931,538个EEG样本）上评估多种机器学习模型和架构。
AI.result: 实验表明，当分类类别来自更高抽象层级时，模型性能显著提升，证实EEG信号对语义抽象程度具有敏感性，且该现象在不同学习技术和架构中均稳定存在。
AI.conclusion: 本研究揭示了抽象深度作为EEG解码的关键维度，为未来神经表征研究提供了新方向，并展示了分层片段采样框架在大规模EEG分析中的有效性。

title: Extending $μ$P: Spectral Conditions for Feature Learning Across Optimizers
comment: 10 main pages, 16 appendix pages and 17 figures; Amended version of the publication in 17th International OPT Workshop on Optimization for Machine Learning
summary: Several variations of adaptive first-order and second-order optimization methods have been proposed to accelerate and scale the training of large language models. The performance of these optimization routines is highly sensitive to the choice of hyperparameters (HPs), which are computationally expensive to tune for large-scale models. Maximal update parameterization $(μ$P$)$ is a set of scaling rules which aims to make the optimal HPs independent of the model size, thereby allowing the HPs tuned on a smaller (computationally cheaper) model to be transferred to train a larger, target model. Despite promising results for SGD and Adam, deriving $μ$P for other optimizers is challenging because the underlying tensor programming approach is difficult to grasp. Building on recent work that introduced spectral conditions as an alternative to tensor programs, we propose a novel framework to derive $μ$P for a broader class of optimizers, including AdamW, ADOPT, LAMB, Sophia, Shampoo and Muon. We implement our $μ$P derivations on multiple benchmark models and demonstrate zero-shot learning rate transfer across increasing model width for the above optimizers. Further, we provide empirical insights into depth-scaling parameterization for these optimizers.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于谱条件的新颖框架，用于为更广泛的优化器（包括AdamW、ADOPT、LAMB、Sophia、Shampoo和Muon）系统性地推导最大更新参数化(μP)。该研究解决了大规模语言模型训练中超参数调优计算成本高昂的难题，通过使超参数独立于模型尺寸，实现从小型模型到大型模型的零样本迁移，从而显著降低训练成本。
AI.motivation: 随着大型语言模型规模的不断扩大，优化器的性能对超参数的敏感性使得超参数调优成为计算瓶颈。虽然最大更新参数化(μP)已被证明能使SGD和Adam的超参数独立于模型尺寸，但将其扩展到其他优化器面临根本性挑战——现有的张量编程方法过于复杂且难以理解，阻碍了理论推导和方法推广。因此，亟需一种更通用的理论框架来突破这一限制。
AI.method: 本研究借鉴了近期将谱条件作为张量编程替代方案的重要进展，提出了一个统一且系统的理论框架。该框架利用谱分析技术，为AdamW、ADOPT、LAMB、Sophia、Shampoo和Muon等多种自适应一阶和二阶优化器推导μP缩放规则，避免了传统张量编程的复杂性，使得参数化推导过程更加透明和易于推广。
AI.result: 通过在多个基准模型上实现上述μP推导，实验结果表明：1）所有研究的优化器均能在增加模型宽度时实现零样本学习率迁移；2）成功获得了关于这些优化器深度缩放参数化的重要实证洞察。这些发现验证了所提框架的有效性和通用性。
AI.conclusion: 本研究成功地将μP的适用范围从SGD和Adam扩展到更广泛的优化器家族，为大规模语言模型训练提供了通用的超参数迁移理论框架。这不仅显著降低了大规模模型的调参成本，也为未来优化器的设计和分析提供了新的理论工具，对推动高效大规模模型训练具有重要意义。

title: Estimation of Confidence Bounds in Binary Classification using Wilson Score Kernel Density Estimation
summary: The performance and ease of use of deep learning-based binary classifiers have improved significantly in recent years. This has opened up the potential for automating critical inspection tasks, which have traditionally only been trusted to be done manually. However, the application of binary classifiers in critical operations depends on the estimation of reliable confidence bounds such that system performance can be ensured up to a given statistical significance. We present Wilson Score Kernel Density Classification, which is a novel kernel-based method for estimating confidence bounds in binary classification. The core of our method is the Wilson Score Kernel Density Estimator, which is a function estimator for estimating confidence bounds in Binomial experiments with conditionally varying success probabilities. Our method is evaluated in the context of selective classification on four different datasets, illustrating its use as a classification head of any feature extractor, including vision foundation models. Our proposed method shows similar performance to Gaussian Process Classification, but at a lower computational complexity.

AI.tldr: 针对关键任务中二元分类器需要可靠置信边界的问题，本文提出威尔逊得分核密度分类——一种新颖的核方法。其核心威尔逊得分核密度估计器专为具有条件变化成功概率的二项实验设计。在选择性分类的四个数据集评估中，该方法性能媲美高斯过程分类，但计算复杂度更低，可作为任意特征提取器的分类头部。
AI.motivation: 尽管基于深度学习的二元分类器性能显著提升并有望实现关键检查任务的自动化，但这些任务传统上依赖人工执行。要将分类器应用于此类关键操作，必须能够估计可靠的置信边界，以确保系统在特定统计显著性水平下的性能可被严格保证。
AI.method: 提出威尔逊得分核密度分类方法，基于威尔逊得分核密度估计器构建。该估计器是一种函数估计器，专门用于估计成功概率条件变化下的二项实验置信边界。采用核方法框架，可直接作为分类头部集成到任意特征提取器（包括视觉基础模型）中。
AI.result: 在四个数据集的选择性分类任务评估中，所提方法展现出与高斯过程分类相当的性能表现，同时显著降低了计算复杂度。
AI.conclusion: 本研究为二元分类提供了一种计算高效的新型置信边界估计方法，使其在保持统计严谨性的同时更适用于实际关键任务场景。

title: Does Order Matter : Connecting The Law of Robustness to Robust Generalization
summary: Bubeck and Sellke (2021) pose as an open problem the connection between the law of robustness and robust generalization. The law of robustness states that overparameterization is necessary for models to interpolate robustly; in particular, robust interpolation requires the learned function to be Lipschitz. Robust generalization asks whether small robust training loss implies small robust test loss. We resolve this problem by explicitly connecting the two for arbitrary data distributions. Specifically, we introduce a nontrivial notion of robust generalization error and convert it into a lower bound on the expected Rademacher complexity of the induced robust loss class. Our bounds recover the $Ω(n^{1/d})$ regime of Wu et al.\ (2023) and show that, up to constants, robust generalization does not change the order of the Lipschitz constant required for smooth interpolation. We conduct experiments to probe the predicted scaling with dataset size and model capacity, testing whether empirical behavior aligns more closely with the predictions of Bubeck and Sellke (2021) or Wu et al.\ (2023). For MNIST, we find that the lower-bound Lipschitz constant scales on the order predicted by Wu et al.\ (2023). Informally, to obtain low robust generalization error, the Lipschitz constant must lie in a range that we bound, and the allowable perturbation radius is linked to the Lipschitz scale.

AI.tldr: 本文解决Bubeck和Sellke (2021)提出的开放性问题，建立鲁棒性法则与鲁棒泛化的定量联系。通过定义鲁棒泛化误差并转化为Rademacher复杂度下界，证明鲁棒泛化不改变Lipschitz常数阶数，且MNIST实验验证了Ω(n^(1/d))的缩放规律。
AI.motivation: 鲁棒性法则表明过参数化模型需满足Lipschitz条件才能实现鲁棒插值，但此法则与鲁棒泛化（小训练损失能否保证小测试损失）的关系尚不明确。厘清二者联系对理解深度学习的对抗鲁棒性本质具有重要意义。
AI.method: 引入非平凡的鲁棒泛化误差概念，将其转化为诱导鲁棒损失类的期望Rademacher复杂度下界。基于该框架，在任意数据分布下建立两个问题的定量桥梁，并推导出紧致的理论界。
AI.result: 理论界恢复了Wu等人(2023)的Ω(n^(1/d)) regime，表明鲁棒泛化在常数范围内不改变平滑插值所需Lipschitz常数的阶数。MNIST实验证实下界Lipschitz常数按Wu等人(2023)预测的阶数缩放。
AI.conclusion: 研究表明，为获得低鲁棒泛化误差，Lipschitz常数必须处于特定有界范围，且扰动半径与Lipschitz尺度相关联。这为深度学习的鲁棒泛化提供了新理论见解，并验证了过参数化模型中鲁棒性与泛化间的根本权衡。

title: Matching Multiple Experts: On the Exploitability of Multi-Agent Imitation Learning
summary: Multi-agent imitation learning (MA-IL) aims to learn optimal policies from expert demonstrations of interactions in multi-agent interactive domains. Despite existing guarantees on the performance of the resulting learned policies, characterizations of how far the learned polices are from a Nash equilibrium are missing for offline MA-IL. In this paper, we demonstrate impossibility and hardness results of learning low-exploitable policies in general $n$-player Markov Games. We do so by providing examples where even exact measure matching fails, and demonstrating a new hardness result on characterizing the Nash gap given a fixed measure matching error. We then show how these challenges can be overcome using strategic dominance assumptions on the expert equilibrium. Specifically, for the case of dominant strategy expert equilibria, assuming Behavioral Cloning error $ε_{\text{BC}}$, this provides a Nash imitation gap of $\mathcal{O}\left(nε_{\text{BC}}/(1-γ)^2\right)$ for a discount factor $γ$. We generalize this result with a new notion of best-response continuity, and argue that this is implicitly encouraged by standard regularization techniques.

AI.tldr: 该论文研究了离线多智能体模仿学习（MA-IL）中学习策略与纳什均衡之间的差距（Nash gap）问题。首先证明了在一般n人马尔可夫博弈中学习低可利用策略的困难性和不可能性；随后在专家均衡具有占优策略或最佳响应连续性的结构假设下，给出了纳什模仿差距的理论上界O(nε_BC/(1-γ)^2)。
AI.motivation: 现有离线多智能体模仿学习研究虽对学习策略性能有所保证，但缺乏对学习策略与纳什均衡之间差距的严格理论刻画。本文旨在填补这一理论空白，系统分析在一般n人马尔可夫博弈中学习低可利用策略的根本性困难，并为该问题提供可行的解决路径。
AI.method: 1）构造反例证明即使精确测度匹配也会失败；2）建立固定测度匹配误差下纳什差距的困难性理论；3）引入专家均衡的战略支配性假设（占优策略均衡）克服前述挑战；4）提出最佳响应连续性概念，并论证其被标准正则化技术隐式促进。
AI.result: 1）在一般n人马尔可夫博弈中，学习低可利用策略存在本质困难，无法获得普适的理论保证；2）当专家策略为占优策略均衡时，在行为克隆误差ε_BC下，纳什模仿差距可被界定为O(nε_BC/(1-γ)^2)；3）最佳响应连续性假设在实践中可通过正则化技术实现。
AI.conclusion: 本文揭示了离线多智能体模仿学习的理论局限性，并证明在特定结构假设下可获得可量化的纳什差距保证。这为设计更鲁棒的多智能体模仿学习算法提供了重要的理论指导。

title: T1: One-to-One Channel-Head Binding for Multivariate Time-Series Imputation
summary: Imputing missing values in multivariate time series remains challenging, especially under diverse missing patterns and heavy missingness. Existing methods suffer from suboptimal performance as corrupted temporal features hinder effective cross-variable information transfer, amplifying reconstruction errors. Robust imputation requires both extracting temporal patterns from sparse observations within each variable and selectively transferring information across variables--yet current approaches excel at one while compromising the other. We introduce T1 (Time series imputation with 1-to-1 channel-head binding), a CNN-Transformer hybrid architecture that achieves robust imputation through Channel-Head Binding--a mechanism creating one-to-one correspondence between CNN channels and attention heads. This design enables selective information transfer: when missingness corrupts certain temporal patterns, their corresponding attention pathways adaptively down-weight based on remaining observable patterns while preserving reliable cross-variable connections through unaffected channels. Experiments on 11 benchmark datasets demonstrate that T1 achieves state-of-the-art performance, reducing MSE by 46% on average compared to the second-best baseline, with particularly strong gains under extreme sparsity (70% missing ratio). The model generalizes to unseen missing patterns without retraining and uses a consistent hyperparameter configuration across all datasets. The code is available at https://github.com/Oppenheimerdinger/T1.

AI.tldr: 针对多变量时间序列缺失值填充的挑战，本文提出T1模型，通过CNN-Transformer混合架构和通道-注意力头绑定机制实现选择性信息传递。在11个基准数据集上，T1比次优方法平均降低46%的MSE，在70%高缺失率下表现尤为突出，且无需重新训练即可泛化到未见缺失模式。
AI.motivation: 现有方法在多变量时间序列缺失值填充中存在两大难题：一是缺失数据会破坏时序特征，阻碍变量间有效信息传递并放大重建误差；二是难以同时实现从稀疏观测中提取时序模式和选择性跨变量信息转移。当前方法往往在两者间权衡，无法兼顾，导致在多样缺失模式和严重缺失情况下性能不佳。
AI.method: 提出T1（Time series imputation with 1-to-1 channel-head binding）模型，采用CNN-Transformer混合架构。核心创新是通道-注意力头绑定机制，建立CNN通道与注意力头的一一对应关系。该机制使模型能根据可观测模式自适应地调整被破坏时序模式对应的注意力权重，同时通过未受影响的通道保持可靠的跨变量连接。
AI.result: 在11个基准数据集上的实验表明，T1达到SOTA性能，相比次优基线平均降低46%的MSE。在极端稀疏性（70%缺失率）下提升尤为显著。模型能泛化到未见缺失模式而无需重新训练，且在所有数据集上使用一致的超参数配置。
AI.conclusion: T1通过创新的通道-注意力头绑定机制，有效解决了多变量时间序列填充中时序特征提取与跨变量信息选择传递的平衡问题，显著提升了在高缺失率场景下的鲁棒性，为实际应用提供了简单而强大的解决方案。

title: PIME: Prototype-based Interpretable MCTS-Enhanced Brain Network Analysis for Disorder Diagnosis
summary: Recent deep learning methods for fMRI-based diagnosis have achieved promising accuracy by modeling functional connectivity networks. However, standard approaches often struggle with noisy interactions, and conventional post-hoc attribution methods may lack reliability, potentially highlighting dataset-specific artifacts. To address these challenges, we introduce PIME, an interpretable framework that bridges intrinsic interpretability with minimal-sufficient subgraph optimization by integrating prototype-based classification and consistency training with structural perturbations during learning. This encourages a structured latent space and enables Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) under a prototype-consistent objective to extract compact minimal-sufficient explanatory subgraphs post-training. Experiments on three benchmark fMRI datasets demonstrate that PIME achieves state-of-the-art performance. Furthermore, by constraining the search space via learned prototypes, PIME identifies critical brain regions that are consistent with established neuroimaging findings. Stability analysis shows 90% reproducibility and consistent explanations across atlases.

title: Localized Dynamics-Aware Domain Adaption for Off-Dynamics Offline Reinforcement Learning
summary: Off-dynamics offline reinforcement learning (RL) aims to learn a policy for a target domain using limited target data and abundant source data collected under different transition dynamics. Existing methods typically address dynamics mismatch either globally over the state space or via pointwise data filtering; these approaches can miss localized cross-domain similarities or incur high computational cost. We propose Localized Dynamics-Aware Domain Adaptation (LoDADA), which exploits localized dynamics mismatch to better reuse source data. LoDADA clusters transitions from source and target datasets and estimates cluster-level dynamics discrepancy via domain discrimination. Source transitions from clusters with small discrepancy are retained, while those from clusters with large discrepancy are filtered out. This yields a fine-grained and scalable data selection strategy that avoids overly coarse global assumptions and expensive per-sample filtering. We provide theoretical insights and extensive experiments across environments with diverse global and local dynamics shifts. Results show that LoDADA consistently outperforms state-of-the-art off-dynamics offline RL methods by better leveraging localized distribution mismatch.

AI.tldr: 针对离策略离线强化学习问题，本文提出局部动力学感知域适应方法，通过聚类和域判别实现局部动力学差异估计，对源域数据进行精细化筛选，避免全局假设和逐样本计算的高开销，有效利用跨域局部相似性。
AI.motivation: 现有离策略离线强化学习方法在利用不同动态的源域和目标域数据时，存在全局匹配忽略局部相似性、逐点过滤计算成本高的局限。为此需要一种既能捕捉局部跨域相似性又具备计算效率的数据选择机制。
AI.method: 局部动力学感知域适应方法首先对源域和目标域数据进行聚类，然后在每个簇级别通过域判别器估计动力学差异，保留差异较小的簇中的源转换样本，过滤差异较大的簇，形成细粒度可扩展的数据选择策略。
AI.result: 在多类全局和局部动力学变化环境下的实验表明，该方法具有理论可解释性，性能持续优于现有最先进离策略离线强化学习方法，验证了局部化利用分布不匹配的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 局部动力学感知域适应通过局部化动力学差异估计，提供了可扩展且高效的数据选择机制，有效解决了离策略离线强化学习中的域适应问题，为处理跨域数据差异提供了新思路。

title: Scaling Vision Transformers: Evaluating DeepSpeed for Image-Centric Workloads
summary: Vision Transformers (ViTs) have demonstrated remarkable potential in image processing tasks by utilizing self-attention mechanisms to capture global relationships within data. However, their scalability is hindered by significant computational and memory demands, especially for large-scale models with many parameters. This study aims to leverage DeepSpeed, a highly efficient distributed training framework that is commonly used for language models, to enhance the scalability and performance of ViTs. We evaluate intra- and inter-node training efficiency across multiple GPU configurations on various datasets like CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100, exploring the impact of distributed data parallelism on training speed, communication overhead, and overall scalability (strong and weak scaling). By systematically varying software parameters, such as batch size and gradient accumulation, we identify key factors influencing performance of distributed training. The experiments in this study provide a foundational basis for applying DeepSpeed to image-related tasks. Future work will extend these investigations to deepen our understanding of DeepSpeed's limitations and explore strategies for optimizing distributed training pipelines for Vision Transformers.

AI.tldr: 本研究针对Vision Transformers在图像处理中的计算与内存可扩展性瓶颈，首次系统性探索了DeepSpeed分布式训练框架在视觉任务中的应用。通过在CIFAR-10/100数据集上的多GPU配置实验，评估了分布式数据并行对训练速度、通信开销及强弱扩展性的影响，为ViTs的分布式训练提供了实证基础。
AI.motivation: Vision Transformers凭借自注意力机制在图像任务中表现卓越，但其巨大的计算与内存需求严重制约了模型扩展性。现有DeepSpeed框架虽在语言模型训练中成效显著，却尚未在视觉领域得到充分验证。本研究旨在填补这一空白，将DeepSpeed的高效分布式训练能力迁移至ViTs，以提升其可扩展性与训练效率。
AI.method: 研究采用控制变量法，在CIFAR-10和CIFAR-100数据集上系统测试了多GPU节点内与节点间的训练效率。通过调节批次大小、梯度累积步数等关键软件参数，量化分析了分布式数据并行策略对训练吞吐量、通信开销及强弱扩展性能的影响，建立了DeepSpeed在视觉任务上的性能基准。
AI.result: 实验结果成功建立了DeepSpeed应用于图像任务的基线性能，验证了其在Vision Transformers分布式训练中的有效性。研究识别出批次大小与梯度累积是影响多GPU扩展效率的关键因素，为后续优化提供了数据支撑。
AI.conclusion: 本研究证实了DeepSpeed框架可显著提升Vision Transformers的训练可扩展性。未来工作将深入剖析DeepSpeed在视觉任务中的局限性，并开发针对性的优化策略以完善分布式训练管线，推动大规模ViTs的高效训练。

title: Probing Graph Neural Network Activation Patterns Through Graph Topology
summary: Curvature notions on graphs provide a theoretical description of graph topology, highlighting bottlenecks and denser connected regions. Artifacts of the message passing paradigm in Graph Neural Networks, such as oversmoothing and oversquashing, have been attributed to these regions. However, it remains unclear how the topology of a graph interacts with the learned preferences of GNNs. Through Massive Activations, which correspond to extreme edge activation values in Graph Transformers, we probe this correspondence. Our findings on synthetic graphs and molecular benchmarks reveal that MAs do not preferentially concentrate on curvature extremes, despite their theoretical link to information flow. On the Long Range Graph Benchmark, we identify a systemic \textit{curvature shift}: global attention mechanisms exacerbate topological bottlenecks, drastically increasing the prevalence of negative curvature. Our work reframes curvature as a diagnostic probe for understanding when and why graph learning fails.

AI.tldr: 本文通过图Transformer中的大规模激活现象，探究图拓扑结构与GNN学习偏好的关系，揭示大规模激活不集中于曲率极值点，并发现全局注意力机制会加剧拓扑瓶颈，导致负曲率增加，从而将曲率重新定义为诊断图学习失败的探针。
AI.motivation: 图曲率可描述拓扑结构特征（如瓶颈和稠密区域），GNN的过度平滑与过度压缩等问题被认为源于这些区域，但图拓扑与GNN学习偏好的相互作用机制尚不明确，亟需系统性研究。
AI.method: 采用大规模激活（Massive Activations）作为探针，即图Transformer中极端边激活值，通过分析其在合成图、分子基准及长程图基准上的分布规律，探究图拓扑与GNN信息流的对应关系。
AI.result: 在合成图和分子数据集上，大规模激活并未优先出现在曲率极值区域；在长程图基准上，发现系统性曲率偏移现象：全局注意力机制会显著加剧拓扑瓶颈，导致负曲率区域大幅增加。
AI.conclusion: 研究将曲率概念重新定位为诊断图学习失效的探针，揭示了注意力机制与拓扑结构间的负面交互作用，为理解GNN失败模式提供了新的理论视角。

title: Ski Rental with Distributional Predictions of Unknown Quality
summary:
We revisit the central online problem of ski rental in the "algorithms with predictions" framework from the point of view of distributional predictions. Ski rental was one of the first problems to be studied with predictions, where a natural prediction is simply the number of ski days. But it is both more natural and potentially more powerful to think of a prediction as a distribution p-hat over the ski days. If the true number of ski days is drawn from some true (but unknown) distribution p, then we show as our main result that there is an algorithm with expected cost at most OPT + O(min(max({eta}, 1) * sqrt(b), b log b)), where OPT is the expected cost of the optimal policy for the true distribution p, b is the cost of buying, and {eta} is the Earth Mover's (Wasserstein-1) distance between p and p-hat. Note that when {eta} < o(sqrt(b)) this gives additive loss less than b (the trivial bound), and when {eta} is arbitrarily large (corresponding to an extremely inaccurate prediction) we still do not pay more than O(b log b) additive loss. An implication of these bounds is that our algorithm has consistency O(sqrt(b)) (additive loss when the prediction error is 0) and robustness O(b log b) (additive loss when the prediction error is arbitrarily large). Moreover, we do not need to assume that we know (or have any bound on) the prediction error {eta}, in contrast with previous work in robust optimization which assumes that we know this error.
  We complement this upper bound with a variety of lower bounds showing that it is essentially tight: not only can the consistency/robustness tradeoff not be improved, but our particular loss function cannot be meaningfully improved.

AI.tldr: 本文从分布预测视角重新研究滑雪租赁问题，提出一种算法其期望成本不超过OPT+O(min(max({eta},1)*sqrt(b), b log b))，其中{eta}为真实分布p与预测分布p-hat间的推土机距离。该算法在预测误差{eta}<o(sqrt(b))时加性损失小于b，在{eta}极大时仍保持O(b log b)的加性损失，实现了O(sqrt(b))一致性与O(b log b)鲁棒性的最优权衡，且无需事先知道预测误差。
AI.motivation: 传统滑雪租赁预测仅给出滑雪天数点估计，而分布预测更自然且强大。现有鲁棒优化方法需预先知道预测误差上界，这在实际中往往不可行。本文旨在设计无需预测误差先验信息的算法，实现预测质量与最坏情况成本的最优平衡。
AI.method: 在"带预测的算法"框架下，将预测形式化为分布p-hat，使用推土机距离（Wasserstein-1距离）{eta}量化预测误差。设计在线算法，其决策基于p-hat，并通过min(max({eta},1)*sqrt(b), b log b)结构统一刻画预测良好与预测恶劣两种场景下的性能损失。
AI.result: 主要结果：算法期望成本≤OPT+O(min(max({eta},1)*sqrt(b), b log b))。当{eta}<o(sqrt(b))时加性损失<b（优于平凡界限）；当{eta}很大时加性损失为O(b log b)。算法一致性O(sqrt(b))，鲁棒性O(b log b)，且无需知道{eta}。配套下界证明该界在一致性-鲁棒性权衡及损失函数两方面均本质紧。
AI.conclusion: 本文将滑雪租赁问题成功推广至分布预测设置，获得了无需预测误差先验信息的最优性能保证。上下界结果证实该算法在一致性、鲁棒性及其权衡方面达到理论极限，为"带预测的算法"提供了新的理解和应用范式。

title: SOM-VQ: Topology-Aware Tokenization for Interactive Generative Models
summary: Vector-quantized representations enable powerful discrete generative models but lack semantic structure in token space, limiting interpretable human control. We introduce SOM-VQ, a tokenization method that combines vector quantization with Self-Organizing Maps to learn discrete codebooks with explicit low-dimensional topology. Unlike standard VQ-VAE, SOM-VQ uses topology-aware updates that preserve neighborhood structure: nearby tokens on a learned grid correspond to semantically similar states, enabling direct geometric manipulation of the latent space. We demonstrate that SOM-VQ produces more learnable token sequences in the evaluated domains while providing an explicit navigable geometry in code space. Critically, the topological organization enables intuitive human-in-the-loop control: users can steer generation by manipulating distances in token space, achieving semantic alignment without frame-level constraints. We focus on human motion generation - a domain where kinematic structure, smooth temporal continuity, and interactive use cases (choreography, rehabilitation, HCI) make topology-aware control especially natural - demonstrating controlled divergence and convergence from reference sequences through simple grid-based sampling. SOM-VQ provides a general framework for interpretable discrete representations applicable to music, gesture, and other interactive generative domains.

AI.tldr: 提出SOM-VQ方法，通过融合向量量化与自组织映射构建具有显式低维拓扑的离散码本，实现语义空间的可导航几何结构，使人类能够通过直观的空间操作控制生成过程，特别适用于人体运动生成等交互场景。
AI.motivation: 标准向量量化表示缺乏令牌空间的语义拓扑结构，导致难以进行可解释的人工干预。在编舞、康复、人机交互等需要精细控制的领域，这种结构缺失限制了生成模型的实用性和可控性。
AI.method: 将自组织映射(SOM)的拓扑保持特性引入VQ-VAE框架，采用拓扑感知更新规则使学习到的网格相邻节点对应语义相似状态，构建可导航的码本几何，支持基于距离的直观空间操控。
AI.result: 在人体运动生成任务中，SOM-VQ产生更易学习的离散序列，同时提供显式可导航的码本空间。用户可通过网格采样简单操作实现参考序列的受控发散与收敛，达成语义对齐且无需逐帧约束。
AI.conclusion: SOM-VQ建立了可解释离散表示的通用框架，通过显式拓扑结构增强生成模型的可控性，其人机交互潜力可扩展至音乐、手势等时序生成领域，为交互式生成AI提供新范式。

title: Sequential Counterfactual Inference for Temporal Clinical Data: Addressing the Time Traveler Dilemma
summary: Counterfactual inference enables clinicians to ask "what if" questions about patient outcomes, but standard methods assume feature independence and simultaneous modifiability -- assumptions violated by longitudinal clinical data. We introduce the Sequential Counterfactual Framework, which respects temporal dependencies in electronic health records by distinguishing immutable features (chronic diagnoses) from controllable features (lab values) and modeling how interventions propagate through time. Applied to 2,723 COVID-19 patients (383 Long COVID heart failure cases, 2,340 matched controls), we demonstrate that 38-67% of patients with chronic conditions would require biologically impossible counterfactuals under naive methods. We identify a cardiorenal cascade (CKD -> AKI -> HF) with relative risks of 2.27 and 1.19 at each step, illustrating temporal propagation that sequential -- but not naive -- counterfactuals can capture. Our framework transforms counterfactual explanation from "what if this feature were different?" to "what if we had intervened earlier, and how would that propagate forward?" --  yielding clinically actionable insights grounded in biological plausibility.

AI.tldr: 针对标准反事实推理在纵向临床数据中因假设特征独立与同时可修改而产生的生物学不合理性问题，本研究提出序贯反事实框架。该框架通过区分不可变特征（慢性诊断）与可控特征（检验值），并建模干预的时间传播效应，在2,723例COVID-19患者队列（383例长新冠心衰，2,340例对照）中验证：38-67%慢性病患者使用传统方法将产生不可能的反事实，并成功识别CKD→AKI→HF级联路径（RR=2.27/1.19），实现了从"特征改变"到"早期干预传播"的临床可操作解释转变。
AI.motivation: 临床反事实推理需要回答"若早期干预会怎样"，但标准方法假设特征独立且可同时修改，这在纵向电子健康记录中不成立。慢性疾病等不可变特征与检验值等可控特征并存，且干预效果随时间传播，导致传统方法产生不现实的反事实问题，限制了其在临床决策支持中的实用性。
AI.method: 设计序贯反事实框架，核心包括：1）特征分类：区分不可变特征（慢性诊断）与可控特征（检验值）；2）时序建模：构建干预在时间维度上的传播机制；3）队列验证：应用至2,723例COVID-19患者的纵向电子健康记录（383例长新冠相关心衰病例，2,340例匹配对照）；4）路径识别：通过反事实推理识别疾病进展的时间依赖路径。
AI.result: 实证发现：1）38-67%的慢性病患者若使用传统朴素方法，将产生生物学上不可能的反事实情景；2）识别出明确的心肾级联反应：CKD→AKI→HF，各步骤相对风险分别为2.27和1.19；3）该时间传播模式仅能被序贯框架捕获，传统方法无法识别；4）框架成功将反事实问题从静态"若某特征不同"转变为动态"若早期干预将如何时序传播"。
AI.conclusion: 该框架有效解决了传统反事实推理在纵向临床数据中的根本局限，通过显式建模时间依赖性与特征异质性，提供了生物学合理且临床可操作的反事实解释。这有助于临床医生理解疾病进展机制，制定基于时间窗的早期干预策略，并为精准医疗决策支持提供了新范式。

title: The Diffusion Duality, Chapter II: $Ψ$-Samplers and Efficient Curriculum
summary: Uniform-state discrete diffusion models excel at few-step generation and guidance due to their ability to self-correct, making them preferred over autoregressive or Masked diffusion models in these settings. However, their sampling quality plateaus with ancestral samplers as the number of steps increases. We introduce a family of Predictor-Corrector (PC) samplers for discrete diffusion that generalize prior methods and apply to arbitrary noise processes. When paired with uniform-state diffusion, our samplers outperform ancestral sampling on both language and image modeling, achieving lower generative perplexity at matched unigram entropy on OpenWebText and better FID/IS scores on CIFAR10.
